alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lincoln (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 12 at 5:09PM EST until January 12 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EST FOR NORTH CENTRAL COLUMBIA...SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN...NORTHWESTERN EDGEFIELD AND SOUTHEASTERN MCCORMICK COUNTIES... At 509 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near J. Strom Thurmond Dam, or 14 miles northwest of Evans, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Hamilton Branch State Park around 515 PM EST. Edgefield around 540 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Leah, Parksville, Modoc, Scott`s Landing, Knox Scout Reservation, Modoc Campground, Double Branches, Wildwood Park, Cleora and Modoc Boat Ramp. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building immediately.
